html: The revelation ends with a message of hope to those who will follow the Lord and inherit his holy mountain, the place of restored Israel. There they will have his presence and enjoy peace and the healing of the soul. The wicked, on the contrary, will have no peace. President Harold B. Lee quoted verses 19 through 21 as an example of Isaiah's attempts to "fortify his people against the wickedness of the world" (CR, Oct. 1973, p. 4).
